original_title: Sri Lanka President visiting Japan, Singapore
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe is visiting Singapore and Japan where he will meet Prime Minister Fumio Kishida also address a conference in Tokyo, a statement said.
In Singapore, he will meet with K. Shanmugam, the Law and Home Affairs Minister, along with high-ranking diplomats, the President’s media office said.
May 24 to 27, he will be in Japan will have talks with Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on “strengthening bilateral relations and addressing regional and international matters,” the statement said.
President Wickremesinghe will also meet Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi, Finance Minister Shun’ichi Suzuki, and Digital Transformation Minister Taro Kono.
He will address Nikkei Forum’s 28th Future of Asia conference in Tokyo on May 25 and 26 where leaders meet to discuss political, economic, and regional issues in the Asia-Pacific region.
The President will engage with the Japan-Sri Lanka Business Cooperation Council, the Japan-Sri Lanka Parliamentary Friendship Association and the Sri Lanka Chamber of Commerce in Japan.
